oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-05-02 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 2, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Marty Robbins (host/performer - although Ray Price was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show) with the Glaser Brothers, guest performer Carl Butler, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1021st broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Carl Butler; Stringbean; Marty Robbins; Glaser Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Marty Robbins introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Marty Robbins, Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Marty Robbins introduces Carl Butler -- The Blues Come Around (Carl Butler) -- Marty Robbins introduces Stringbean -- Hey, Mr. Banjo (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner introduces Marty Robbins -- The Hanging Tree (Marty Robbins, Glaser Brothers) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Marty Robbins) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Minnie Pearl; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Glaser Brothers; Robbins, Marty; Butler, Carl
